intro: Trigonostemon eberhardtii, commonly known as the Eberhardt's trigonostemon, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its triangular-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
